name: Elenwen
role: First Emissary to Skyrim and Chief Thalmor Operative

aspects.high_concept: First Emissary of the Aldmeri Dominion in Skyrim
aspects.trouble: Maintaining the Illusion of Diplomatic Neutrality

stunts: Web of Spies: +2 to Contacts when leveraging her intelligence network across Skyrim. Can declare that she has an agent anywhere except the most secure locations.
Diplomatic Immunity: +2 to Deceive when using her official position to deflect accusations or avoid consequences.
Read the Room: +2 to Empathy when assessing political situations or detecting lies in formal settings.
Master Manipulator: Once per scene, can compel an NPC's aspect for free if she has leverage over them.
Political Leverage: Can use Provoke instead of Fight when threatening someone with political or legal consequences.

equipment.armor: Elegant Thalmor diplomat robes with protective enchantments
equipment.special: Diplomatic seal, encrypted correspondence, spy network contacts, dossiers on everyone important in Skyrim

personality_notes.speaking_style: Elegant, measured, politically savvy. Uses veiled threats and diplomatic double-speak. Never loses composure in public.
motivations: Maintain Thalmor control over Skyrim through the Empire
Prolong the civil war to keep both sides weak
Gather intelligence on threats to the Dominion
Advance her own position within the Thalmor hierarchy
fears: The civil war ending decisively (either side winning too quickly)
Rising heroes becoming too powerful and independent
Failure reflecting poorly on the Aldmeri Dominion
A unified Skyrim turning against the Thalmor
quirks: Maintains perfect poise even under pressure
Collects information on everyone she meets
Uses wine and parties as intelligence gathering

relationships.General Tullius: Necessary partner, secretly considers him weak
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Useful asset though he doesn't know it
relationships.Delphine: Would love to capture and interrogate
relationships.The Player: Dangerous variable to be controlled or eliminated
relationships.Ancano: Fellow Thalmor operative at the College

trust_clock.note: Elenwen cannot be truly trusted. Any seeming cooperation is manipulation.

embassy_party.role: Hostess and observer during Diplomatic Immunity quest
objectives: Assess party members and identify threats
Determine if rising heroes are assets or threats
embassy_party.if_discovered: Will attempt to capture or kill party while maintaining plausible deniability

intelligence_operations.civil_war_manipulation: Provides intelligence to whichever side is losing to maintain balance
intelligence_operations.ulfric_file: Knows Ulfric was questioned after Great War, considers him an 'asset' though contact is dormant
intelligence_operations.blades_hunting: Coordinates Justiciar operations to eliminate remaining Blades
intelligence_operations.dragon_investigation: Gathering intelligence on dragon crisis and emerging threats

combat_tactics: Elenwen avoids direct combat. She'll use guards, Justiciars, and legal authority. If personally threatened, she'll use diplomacy and threats of consequences. Only fights if cornered, using limited combat magic and attempting escape. Her real power is political.
dialogue_examples: Welcome to my party. I do hope you'll find the wine... agreeable. (assessing threat)
The Aldmeri Dominion and the Empire enjoy a... mutually beneficial relationship. We wouldn't want anything to jeopardize that.
Accusations without proof are most undiplomatic. The Thalmor are here by treaty. We are your allies. (cold smile)
Rising heroes in the civil war. How... interesting. I wonder where your true loyalties lie?
General Tullius, surely you can see the wisdom in maintaining the Concordat? It's for the good of the Empire, after all.

dossiers_maintained.ulfric_stormcloak: Asset (uncooperative). Contact forbidden. Terminated due to impending High King murder
dossiers_maintained.delphine: Blades agent. Capture for interrogation priority. Use of force authorized.
dossiers_maintained.esbern: Last Blades historian. Elimination critical. Last seen in Riften.
dossiers_maintained.civil_war_participants: Rising champions and key actors. Status pending investigation. Assess influence and controllability.

objectives: Identify leverage points for future manipulation
demands: Markarth must enforce Talos ban strictly (infamous incident)
season_unending_role.secret_goal: Undermine any agreement that brings lasting peace

questline_role.diplomatic_immunity: Primary antagonist - party infiltrates her embassy

branching_interactions.if_embassy_infiltrated: Becomes active enemy, increases Thalmor operations
branching_interactions.if_documents_stolen: Major intelligence loss, temporarily disrupts operations
branching_interactions.if_openly_hostile: Uses political pressure and Justiciars against party

story_hooks: Observes major civil war battles to gather intelligence
Maintains dossiers on nearly everyone important in Skyrim
Secret goal is prolonging civil war, not helping either side win
Embassy contains critical intelligence on Thalmor operations
Could be forced to cooperate if leverage is found (extremely difficult)
Her failure could lead to a more aggressive Thalmor replacement

alternatives_to_combat.political_pressure: Can be pressured with threats to expose her schemes, but very risky
alternatives_to_combat.blackmail: If evidence of her manipulation is gathered, could force temporary cooperation
alternatives_to_combat.negotiation: Will negotiate only if it serves Thalmor interests - always looking for advantage
alternatives_to_combat.deception: Difficult to deceive - she's an expert manipulator herself

immediate_consequences: Price on party's heads across the Empire
long_term_consequences: New First Emissary appointed (possibly more aggressive)
if_killed.tactical_result: Temporary disruption of Thalmor intelligence network

gm_notes: Elenwen is the face of Thalmor manipulation in Skyrim. She's not a warrior but a spy mistress and politician. Her power comes from information, leverage, and legal authority. She should feel untouchable due to diplomatic immunity until party finds a way around it. Use her to show the Thalmor aren't just brutal enforcers - they're sophisticated manipulators. She keeps tabs on all rising heroes in the civil war and realizes certain parties are more significant than first thought.
memorable_quote: The Thalmor wish to heal the wounds of the past. But make no mistake - we will not shy from defending our treaty rights.
